answers.answer: Wish I had an answer for you.  I did do a quick search online and did not find anything BUT I am wondering what, if anything, you take for your RA?  Maybe this has more to do with a drug interaction?

question: I have had RA since 1972 and it is fairly well controlled. Some hand and foot deformity and a new knee. Recently a Dr. said I needed to start on thyroxine. The very next day my right index finger went numb, followed by others over next week or so.  Lately (after ca 3 mos) my lower arms ache at night and also seems like skin is numb and my fingers feel slightly swollen. About the same time I started the meds I noticed a red eye ball. The eye Dr. told me it meant active RA happening.  Has anyone else experienced these symptoms after starting thyroxine?  Can it make RA worse, or even perhaps trigger diabetes which the DR. wants to test for soon?
title: RA & adding thyroid treatment
